name: Echo Choir Winter Concert, Lift Up Your Wings
description:
Join us for a celebration of community through harmony with special guests Las Brujas del Barrio. 

Las Brujas del Barrio is a Toronto-based Latin American folk ensemble founded by Chilean vocalists Valentina Harper and Alejandra Alvarado, joined by multi-instrumentalist Daniel Saavedra, Oriana Barbato and other guest musicians. 

Through traditional, folk, Indigenous, and protest songs, the group revives the voices of their ancestors and the struggles of Latin America with haunting harmonies and political soul.

name: Orchestra Toronto: Seasonal Celebration with Sultans of String

location.name: George Weston Recital Hall, Meridian Arts Centre

description:
Celebrate the season with award-winning ensemble Sultans of String as they bring their globally inspired Christmas Caravan to the stage. 

Led by Queen's Diamond Jubilee Medal recipient Chris McKhool, this concert features a dynamic mix of seasonal favourites, reimagined through a world music lens. 

With influences ranging from flamenco and Django-jazz to Turkish and Caribbean traditions, the program includes inventive arrangements of Jingle Bells, Silent Night, Jesu, Joy of Man's Desiring, and Little Drummer Boy, alongside exuberant original works. This cross-cultural holiday celebration offers warmth, energy, and a fresh perspective on familiar melodies.

name: Remote Gallery Winter Art Market and Exhibition
description:
Just in time for the holiday season! Come support local artists and grab the perfect handmade gifts for your loved ones. Akin artists from across the city will be selling ceramics, paintings, jewelry illustrations, crafts and more!

We can't wait to see you there. Please visit our social media for artist highlights and event updates!

name: Christmas Sing 'n' Ring

location.name: St. John's York Mills Anglican Church

description:
Join the Handbell Ringers, Chimers, Soloists and Band to welcome the holiday season! 

Bring friends and family to get into the holiday spirit with all your favourite seasonal songs!

name: Advent Carol Service
description:
Enjoy Music and Readings for Advent with choir and organ, trumpet, flute and violin. 

Music by Gardner, Howells, Manz, McDowall, McKie and RÃ¼tti. Choir conducted by Jack Hattey. John Tuttle on organ. 

All are invited to a reception following the service. 

Donations to Bloor West Food Bank are kindly encouraged.

name: The Once Christmas
description:
The Once have been performing across Newfoundland and Labrador and the world for the past 16 years. 

Their songs and videos have gathered millions of views from fans across the globe and lucky Hugh's Room enthusiasts have been fortunate to attend their prior sold-out performances

This holiday season, they are doing something a little different, as they'll regale us with stories and warm our hearts with their ice melting harmonies.

name: Youth Arts Mentorship at Spadina Museum
description:
Beginning December 7th at Spadina Museum, discover the vibrant voices of eight young Toronto artists under the mentorship of Saretta Khan. In a series of  workshops, the youth artists explored various art techniques such as acrylics, texture painting, collaging, oil pastels, and mixed media.  Their final project was to create expressive and meaningful mixed-media portrait collages which are now displayed on the lower level of the museum.

Celebrate the creativity, passion and stories of youth in a series of eight inspiring installations across the city at Toronto History Museum sites. These installations are produced under the Youth Arts Mentorship program, which empowers emerging talent to experience self-discovery and artistic expression through visual arts.

name: Allan Gardens Holiday Market
description:
ðŸŽ„Join Friends of Allan Gardens for a festive Sunday Holiday Market! 

âœ¨ Discover local vendors, seasonal treats, and holiday treasures â€” and don't miss the City of Toronto's stunning Poinsettia Flower Show inside the Conservatory.

âœ¨ Come together with friends, family, and neighbours to celebrate community, creativity, and the beauty of the season, all in the heart of downtown Toronto.

name: Toronto Sunday Market: Christmas Markets
description:
A curated holiday shopping experience featuring Toronto's best local makers, vintage vendors, and food artisans inside the historic Parkdale Hall. Each weekend offers new vendors, and the perfect chance to find unique gifts while supporting small businesses.

Free Entry & Gift Wrapping: December 7, 14, 21

name: What Makes It GreatÂ® with Rob Kapilow

location.name: Jane Mallett Theatre, St. Lawrence Centre for the Arts

description:
Rob Kapilow has rightfully earned the unlikely title of "celebrity music educator".

With sharp insights, boundless curiosity and a deep appreciation for music's emotional power, he has been inspiring audiences for decades. This time, Kapilow delves into the vibrant energy and evocative storytelling of Spring and Summer from Vivaldi's iconic Four Seasons, with Isabella Perron (violin) and the Canadian Chamber Orchestra. 

Bursting with color, drama, and dazzling virtuosity, these masterpieces capture the awakening of nature, the warmth of the sun and the tempestuous storms of summer, all brought to life with fresh insights that will captivate both newcomers and lifelong admirers alike.

"He is a winning combination of Leonard Bernstein and Bill Nye the Science Guy, in infectiously enthusiastic explainer of the inner mechanical workings of music, that most abstract of all arts." - The New York Times.

name: Riverdale Share Concert
description:
Kick off the festive season with this wonderful holiday tradition! 

For over three decades, this event has gathered some of Toronto's most talented performers for a fun-filled, diverse holiday celebration, all in support of local charities. Since its inception, we have raised hundreds of thousands of dollars for charitable organizations and truckloads of food for local food banks. 

This year's stellar line-up includes: Trainwreck, The Daniel Raums, Mia Sheard, Jen Schaffer and the Shiners, Michael Brennan, Jamie Shannon, Anne Lederman, Suzy Wilde and the cast of Predictable Holiday RomCom, Hermina George, Teya Carlson, Christina Hutt, Litt Dance and Music, Artist's Play Dancers, Bowmore School Choir, the Riverdale Share Band, Mr. Grinch, Santa Claus and a yet-to-be-announced special guest!

name: Toronto Art Crawl Christmas Pop-Up
description:
Thrilled to invite you back to our 10th Annual Christmas POP UP! 
A FREE Christmas POP UP for all!

We invite you to come shop directly from the hands of 120+ amazingly talented Toronto artists and artisans, at the beautiful historic Great Hall on Toronto's trendy Queen Street West. If you are looking for art, photography, sculptures, jewellery, fashion, home decor, skin care and more one of a kind items, you won't want to miss this one day market.

Our event also features food vendors and DJ Kid Artik! So bring your dancing shoes, you'll be dancing while shopping.

name: The Disability Holiday Festival
description: This forth annual holiday market will feature work created by disabled artists while celebrating the diversity of the holiday season in Toronto. Stop by to shop for arts and crafts made by local disabled artists, participate in multiple community-building events such as a free photo booth and a card-making station, listen to live music from disabled musicians, and enjoy food & drinks from community vendors to keep you warm and cozy!

name: Toronto Tango Community Orchestra
description:
Founded by Solidaridad Tango in 2024 to grow our love for tango and each other. 

We are a free community music-making program that welcomes musicians of all ages and abilities. Our program is run entirely on audience donations, and we thank you for your support!

name: Freeman Dre
description: Parkdale romantic songs featuring everyone's favourite troubadour!

name: The AMOT Orchestra
description:
We are a group/collective focused on exploring the meeting points between disciplines and cultures, and imagining new musical forms to reflect the aesthetics and multiculturalism of the Canadian identity with an emphasis on improvisation and individuality.

Modelled primarily on the approach of the Australian Art Orchestra, AMOT's intentions are threefold, creating projects that focus on reimagining bodies of work, creation of new works that exhibit distinct artistic notions, as well as collaborations in cultural and improvisatory settings with members of the broader Canadian music community.

AMOT is thrilled to feature Esra GurÃ§ay in a newly composed, multi-movement work that weaves together three powerful poems with a dynamic set of music drawn from jazz, folk, and art orchestra traditions.

name: Ariane Morin and Ferhan Dogmusoz
description: Late-night Turkish music on the saxophone and oud, a short, lute-style instrument.

name: A Very Merry Mirvish Holiday Concert
description:
Experience our return at The Distillery Winter Village, featuring cast members from four Mirvish musicals, including the smash-hit Broadway favourite & Juliet, Rodgers and Hammerstein's beloved The Sound of Music, the high-voltage rock musical We Will Rock You and the upcoming Tony-winning Shucked.

With opening remarks from Mayor Olivia Chow, and hosted by award-winning television host Bill Coulter, the evening will feature standout performances from each production along with timeless holiday classics under The Distillery Winter Village's 55-foot Christmas Tree in the heart of the historic district.

Audience members will also have the chance to win premium tickets to Mirvish Productions on stage in Toronto.

name: Joan Smith and the Jane Does live at DROM Taberna
description: Joan Smith, she of "towering pipes and a remarkable dirty guitar tone" (torontomusicreviews.com), and guitarist/producer Tom Juhas form the Jane Does â€“ a femme fronted dance rock machine with cutting vocals that amp up to the edge of sanity, pulsing rock beats and relentless guitars which remind noted radio personality and music historian Jeff Woods of 'Queens of the Stone Age fronted by Stevie Nicks'.
